thread.title: Will Argentina’s Nightmare Spread?

author: wsjcom
title: Will Argentina’s Nightmare Spread?
text: “Emerging markets are under pressure because the dollar is strong and U.S. rates are rising, while growth in China, the key spoke in international commerce, is slowing. Moreover, oil prices are high, pressuring current account balances. What’s unusual is that this is all happening at once,” Nathaniel Taplin writes for The Wall Street Journal. “In 2013, during the original ‘taper tantrum,’ oil was expensive but the dollar never strengthened dramatically, in part because emerging-market growth still looked relatively strong. In fact, the last time the world had a strong dollar, high oil prices, and a rosy U.S. economy was... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
